result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob R Lewis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Count. Amphetam. (>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(2)(bm).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: La Crosse County Clerk of Courts

miscConds.notes:
The Def is to obtain and maintain full time employment or enroll in a course of education or a combination of both.

Obtain GED or HSSD.
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any know drug users/dealers.
.

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendent in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

timeConds.notes: As soon a Brunk House be is ready will give furlough & then can come back to court and ask for Stay. Once released from Brunk House or geting close to getting released, court will consider stay for the rest of the jail.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime
